articles.title: Could getting enough vitamin D reduce COVID-19 death risks by 52%? - Daily Mail
articles.description: New Boston University research found that people who don't get enough of the vitamin are  far more likely to become severely ill, develop sepsis or even die after contracting coronavirus.
articles.content:
People who get enough vitamin D are at a 52 percent lower risk of dying of COVID-19 than people who are deficient for the 'sunshine vitamin,' new research reveals.
